buildup.text: Marathon runners need 30 to 60 grams of carbs per hour from gels, drinks, or real food.

discovery.text: Elite runners now use dual-source carbsâ€”glucose plus fructoseâ€”to absorb up to 90 grams per hour.

twist.text: GI distress causes more dropouts than injuries. Most stomach issues come from untested race nutrition.

climax.text: Every gel and drink must be rehearsed in training. Race day is never the time to try something new.

punchline.text: Nothing new on race day is the golden rule of nutrition.
